results.title: Burma: people of the river
results.creator_credit: Milan Herzog and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: The varied regions and ways of living in Burma - the rivers that serve as highways; the rice fields in the delta and river valleys; jungle that yields harvests of teakwood and bamboo; the village life; and the city of Rangoon, centre of commerce, transportation and ancient culture.

results.title: Burma Railway
results.brief_description: A documentary covering the imprisonment of the ill-fated Australian 8th Division after the fall of Singapore in 1942, and the construction by the prisoners of war of the Burma Railway.

results.title: Burke and Wills
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Explorers”.
In 1860 Robert Burke and a party of explorers began the first overland crossing of Australia from Melbourne to the Gulf of Carpentaria. Both Burke and Wills perished on the way back. The film reconstructs the events that led to their deaths. This film is suitable for Years 7-12.

results.title: Buried treasure
results.creator_credit: Donald Carter, Coal Utilization Council and Gaumont-British Instructional
results.brief_description: An account of the British coal industry covering: the geological formation of coal; the layout and ventilation of a modern mine; the work of individual coal miners; the organization of the various shifts throughout the day; methods employed to extract coal from the coal face; cleaning, grading and transport of coal at the pit-head. “Supervised by the Coal Utilization Council in association with John Grierson and Arthur Elton”.

results.title: Buried cities
results.brief_description: Shows the excavations and reconstructions of the cities of Pompeii and Herculaneum. Gives an account of the eruption of Vesuvius in 79 AD and depicts life at the time.

results.title: Buns
results.creator_credit: Thomas Bammel, Depicture Company and Oxford Films (U.S.)
results.brief_description: Shows a large factory complete with automation and assembly line, producing hamburger buns. Covers each detail of this production from the giant kneader handling hundreds of pounds of dough to the automatic packaging and shipping. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Thomas Bammel, Depicture Company and Oxford Films (U.S.)

results.title: Bunny
results.creator_credit: Edwin James Lynch, Philip Ellery and Western Australia Film Council
results.brief_description: A young girl, Jane (Tamara Liffers), left to her own devices at home proceeds to go about her morning ritual. She feeds herself, her pet fish and dog then goes to secretly feed the next door neighbour’s pet rabbit. Jane hides when she spots Mrs. Nextdoor (Tiffany Evans) entering the garden who unbeknowns to her is about to bury the dead rabbit. Jane panics when her dog has brought in the dead carcus of the rabbit believing that the dog has killed the rabbit. Jane’s matter of fact approach to right the situation illustrates the naivity and simplicity of a child’s mind. Cast also includes Ivor Bowen.

results.title: Buma: African sculpture speaks
results.creator_credit: Henry R. Cassirer and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Twenty different antique sculptures from Central and West Africa are used to illustrate the important part played by carved wooden statues and masks in the everyday life of native Africans. The use of masks as protection or reassurance against common dangers and fears is dramatised with the assistance of tribal drum music actually recorded in Africa. Antique sculpture used in the film is from the Segy Galleries, New York.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Henry R. Cassirer and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films

results.title: Bully for hockey
results.creator_credit: Ivan Hexter, Peter Johnson, Film Australia and Moving Picture Company
results.brief_description: General interest film focusing on all age levels of men’s and women’s hockey within Doncaster Hockey Club. Includes training, fitness, social aspects. Suitable for secondary years 7-12.
